Overview
Overview / Color and Grayscale Printing / RICOH AFP color and grayscale products / Print servers / RICOH ProcessDirector
RICOH ProcessDirector
RICOH ProcessDirector is a database-driven print workflow system that lets you manage all aspects of your printing process. The server runs on
Linux or Windows systems and is accessed using a web browser-based interface. RICOH ProcessDirector can receive and process AFP print jobs
that include AFP color management objects.
RICOH ProcessDirector can also receive line data print jobs that refer to CMRs and data objects and convert them into AFP using a step based on
the ConvertLineDataJobIntoAFP step template.
RICOH ProcessDirector processes CMRs and data objects similar to the way it processes other AFP resources. You can add the resource libraries
that you create using AFP Resource Installer to the AFP resource path property on a print job or in the job defaults for your workflows. Then,
RICOH ProcessDirector can search those resource libraries to find data objects and CMRs when print jobs request them.
Parent topic: Print servers
